ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: New to EQ and can't get it started!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: If this problem persists, email me and I can ask at the chat for you. luv, -Su
ygData.messageBody:
If this problem persists, email me and I can ask at the chat for you.
luv,
-Su


> I've read about that, but I've got an extra fan installed on the
> side of the case blowing on the cpu and videocard. Also, I'm
> not playing the game. I can't get past the account setup. I
> didn't mention that I had downloaded the full version of the game a
> few days ago and got this problem then as well. one of the things
> that I did was remove my unused 56k pci modem, then I moved my
> network card to a different slot and was able to gett into the new
> account screen. I was able to add my name and other registration
> stuff, but couldn't go any further as I had no credit card(they are
> evil) so I went to get a gamecard and when I tried to get into the
> account, it kicked me out again!! Back to square one!! I tried
> buying the game on cd and got the same issue.
> By the way I did defrag(and needed it) but to no avail.
> My big question is why can't I post at the station? I have cookies
> enabled, I'm signed in and it says "hi muddywag" at the top, but it
> keeps telling me that I need to be registered. AHHH! IWANNA KILL A
> BAT!! By the way I CAN play the tutorial. Which only served to let
> me know that I'll REALLY like this game- someday!!
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "The Mad Macinchaote" <scendera@v...> wrote:
> > I had problems with EQ crashing too...turned out to be a filthy
> and dying cpu fan. If you're crashing out of high end games but fine
> on the desktop, look very seriously into heat as a cause.
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Louis Gumaer
> > To: EverQuest@y...
> > Sent: Sunday, July 07, 2002 5:49 AM
> > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New to EQ and can't get it started!!!
> >
> >
> > Have you defragged your hard drive lately? I have had some
> instances in games, DAOC, Warcraft III, where the game would crash
> or drop to the desktop and defragging the drive helped for a while.
> I have actually been having problems with EQ dropping unexpectedly
> lately now that I think about it. I have yet to defrag my HD but I
> know I haven't done it in over a month, so it could be the problem.
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: muddywag
> > To: EverQuest@y...
> > Sent: Sunday, July 07, 2002 2:26 AM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] New to EQ and can't get it started!!!
> >
> >
> > Hello. I bought eq today along with a game card. I installed
> it,
> > went to new account, and when I click it it bounces me to the
> > desktop. i dried disabling my firewall, soundcard, starting
> with
> > all unnecessary processes disabled. uninstalled/installed
> many
> > times. checked for irq and I found that the cable modem
> network
> > cark was sharing 12 with the onboard sound, tried moving the
> network
> > card and ended up having to reactivate xp! As it stands, I've
> yet
> > to set foot in Norrath.
> > I registered at the Station, and tried to use the tech
> bulliten
> > board, but it won't let me post, says that I need to me a
> regisered
> > user-- I thought I was!!
> > anyways, that's why I'm here. PLEASE HELP!! I can't wait to
> play
> > my new game!!!
> > Thanks
> > Dan
> >
